rComments: I took a course with Prof Rofel a couple of years ago and after the courses in Cultural Anthropology I have taken since then, I have to say she is particularly good at challenging the intelligence of students. If that is not what we value in our professors, then why be in school at all? This is what we have come for and Professor Rofel delivers.
Learned a LOT. Great readings, but tons of reading (expected for theory though). She clearly loves the subject but her teaching style wasn't my cup of tea.

Expectations were extremely for an introductory class. Lecture felt like discussion and was difficult to take notes at times since Prof. Rofel spoke too fast. Tons of guest lecturers, two papers instead of midterms, weekly reading responses, and presentations. Most readings were interesting, but too long and difficult to manage with other classes.

Lisa has clear lectures and is obviously knowledgeable in her subject. However, for an undergrad intro/GE/Pre-req class, the expectations are too high and the readings are too long and too mundane. Weekly pop quizzes and my TA graded weekly assign. as if they were senior thesis proposals. Rough class, could be interesting, but hated it.

She's alright. She is clearly knowledgeable about the discipline and assigns interesting things to read, but her assignments are very clear and we don't go over the texts as much as I would like. Overall, if you put in effort its an easy A.

Yes, this review is about me being upset about my grade - I received a B+ when I deserved an A. Here's why. I received 100% on all her quizzes and A's on all the assignments (and there were a lot) and midterm. Her final screwed me over - it was interpreting a completely **** poem that made no sense and had little relevance to our class.

Great professor.  I think most of the bad reviews come from people who think that you aren't supposed to work hard in college.  Her class was challenging and very rewarding.  She is very knowledgeable and interested in the opinions of her students.  Great teacher with high expectations.
Lisa is a tough teacher, but she knows her stuffÂ¡ She's very very smart and as much as she asks of you, she gives back. If you ask for help, she is happy to give it.

Her assignments aren't incredibly clear.  She stands in fron of the class and just sort of reads over her notes. She's not a very charismatic lecturer. She can be a little disrespectful and disregards students' questions or arguments. She's okay, but I won't take another class with her.

Not a very good professor at all. The readings assigned were VERY lengthy and VERY dense. She expected us to know the history of China prior to this class and was very vague about giving context to the material discussed.   The class was a wasted experience and I don't feel like I really gained anything from it. Definitely would not recommend Lis

She is a nice teacher, but she assigns so much useless boring reading that is sooooo long, she seems to think we don't have a life. She grades hard and is not too subtle if she thinks you are wrong. There are no lecture notes which is very frustrating. Overall I would not take this class or another with this teacher.

I liked the course material, but was unsure about what she wanted from us.  I was a bit embittered because I received my lowest UCSC grade in her class.  Her TA was horrible (part of the reason for the grade), but I thought as a professor, she was interesting.  I liked her group assignments.  We did ours on 90210, Friends, The Simpsons, etc.  that alone made it worth it.

Had a bad experience with her before, but she was INCREDIBLY helpful in this class.  Let us chose our own topics and gave us the freedom sorely lacking in other classes.  Not very clear tho at times on what needs to be improved on assignments.
She's the one of the brightest profs in the department--she makes you work but you learn.

Our entire grade was based on a giant pair project.  My partner flaked out, and I was told to deal with it.  She wanted me to redo all my work halfway through the quarter because she didn't like how I had written it, but wouldn't tell me what she did want

Not at all what the course description says. Class covers movies and TV ONLY.  You look for what she wants, that's it. You must stick within her guidelines period.  Pushes her own agenda (queer theory mostly). Didn't explain things very well.
